oddNumberPricing.description: Use specific odd numbers to signal careful analysis
oddNumberPricing.psychology: Round numbers feel arbitrary. Odd numbers suggest precise calculation.
oddNumberPricing.roundingNotes: When converting round numbers to odd, round DOWN (more aggressive opening)

distressedProperty.definition: 120+ days on market, multiple price drops, failed escrows
distressedProperty.notes: Seller is motivated, market has rejected current price

staleProperty.notes: Property has issues or is overpriced

hotProperty.notes: May need to offer at or above list

marketTimeDiscounts.description: Additional discount based on days on market
marketTimeDiscounts.notes: Extended time signals problems. Each threshold adds to opening discount.

priceDropPenalty.description: Each price drop signals seller desperation

failedEscrowPenalty.notes: Always ask why previous buyer backed out

maximumOfferFormula.convergenceRule: Both methods should produce similar results. If >10% apart, investigate.

firmMaximumRule.description: Maximum offer is FIRM. Beyond this, move-in ready is better value.
firmMaximumRule.notes: Add 5% buffer below calculated fair value for negotiation room
